shinyVirga 0.41.1
  • Reference

    Create a driver.js callout Must include shinyVirga::use_driver.js() & useShinyJS in the head of the page.

    js_callout.Rd

    Create a driver.js callout Must include shinyVirga::use_driver.js() & useShinyJS in the head of the page.

    Usage

    js_callout(
  el,
  title,
  description,
  side = NULL,
  align = NULL,
  animate = TRUE,
  overlayColor = "black",
  smoothScroll = FALSE,
  allowClose = TRUE,
  overlayOpacity = 0.5,
  stagePadding = 10,
  stageRadius = 5,
  allowKeyboardControl = TRUE,
  disableActiveInteraction = FALSE,
  popoverClass = "scoped-class",
  popoverOffset = 10,
  showButtons = NULL,
  disableButtons = NULL,
  showProgress = FALSE,
  progressText = FALSE,
  nextBtnText = "Next",
  prevBtnText = "Previous",
  doneBtnText = "Done",
  onPopoverRender = NULL,
  onHighlightStarted = NULL,
  onHighlighted = NULL,
  onDeselected = NULL,
  onDestroyStarted = NULL,
  onDestroyed = NULL,
  onNextClick = NULL,
  onPrevClick = NULL,
  onCloseClick = NULL,
  asis = FALSE,
  .ns = ns_find()
)

    Arguments

    el

    chr ID or class of element. If a character not prefixed by . for a class or # for an ID, it will be assumed and ID and # will be added.

    title

    chr Title of popover

    description

    chr Description for it

    side

    chr The position of the popover relative to the target element. One of "top", "right", "bottom", "left".

    align

    chr The alignment of the popover relative to the target element. One of "start", 'center', "end".

    animate

    lgl Whether to animate the product tour. (default: true)

    overlayColor

    chr Overlay color. (default: black) This is useful when you have a dark background and want to highlight elements with a light background color.

    smoothScroll

    lgl Whether to smooth scroll to the highlighted element. (default: false)

    allowClose

    lgl Whether to allow closing the popover by clicking on the backdrop. (default: true)

    overlayOpacity

    num Opacity of the backdrop. (default: 0.5)

    stagePadding

    num Distance between the highlighted element and the cutout. (default: 10)

    stageRadius

    num Radius of the cutout around the highlighted element. (default: 5)

    allowKeyboardControl

    lgl Whether to allow keyboard navigation. (default: true)

    disableActiveInteraction

    lgl Whether to disable interaction with the highlighted element. (default: false)

    popoverClass

    chr If you want to add custom class to the popover

    popoverOffset

    num Distance between the popover and the highlighted element. (default: 10)

    showButtons

    chr Array of buttons to show in the popover. Defaults to "next", "previous", "close" for product tours and [] for single element highlighting.

    disableButtons

    chr Array of buttons to disable. This is useful when you want to show some of the buttons, but disable some of them.

    showProgress

    lgl Whether to show the progress text in popover. (default: false)

    progressText

    chr See docs for details

    nextBtnText

    chr See docs for details

    prevBtnText

    chr See docs for details

    doneBtnText

    chr See docs for details

    onPopoverRender

    chr See docs for details

    onHighlightStarted

    chr See docs for details

    onHighlighted

    chr See docs for details

    onDeselected

    chr See docs for details

    onDestroyStarted

    chr See docs for details

    onDestroyed

    chr See docs for details

    onNextClick

    chr See docs for details

    onPrevClick

    chr See docs for details

    onCloseClick

    chr See docs for details

    asis

    If TRUE, use the ID as-is even when inside a module (instead of adding the namespace prefix to the ID).

    .ns

    fun ns function. Typically found automatically.

    closeBtnText

    chr See docs for details

    See also

    Other JS: js_after(), js_callback(), js_glow(), js_mouseover_once(), js_picker_disable(), js_picker_enable(), js_set_input_val(), use_driver.js()

    Examples

    
js_callout('my_id', "Tooltip title", "Tooltip description")
#> Warning: Could not find ns function. Using `function(x) x`
#> Error: shinyjs: could not find the Shiny session object. This usually happens when a shinyjs function is called from a context that wasn't set up by a Shiny session.
